demise.translation[0].definitions[0].def: the end of something that used to exist
demise.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: the imminent demise  (=happening soon) of the local newspaper
demise.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: the mystery surrounding Elenaâ€™s untimely demise  (=when death happens sooner than is normal or expected)
demise.translation[1].definitions[0].def: when a property owner rents property to someone, or the rented property itself
demise.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Where the demise includes the whole of a building the airspace above the building may be excluded.
demise.translation[2].definitions[0].def: if the owner of a property demises it, they rent it to someone
demise.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: The plaintiff landlord had demised premises to the defendant for 21 years.
